org.openglove.api.java

Class Communication

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openglove.api.java.Communication

  • public class Communication
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a comunication instance between the API and the glove. Provide methods for send and receive data through serial port

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Communication()
      Initialize an instance of Communication class without open the communication with the device
      Communication(java.lang.String portName, int baudRate)
      Initialize an instance of Communication class, opening the communication using the specified port and baudrate

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closePort()
      Close the serial communication
      java.lang.String[] getPortNames()
      List all active serial ports names
      boolean openPort(java.lang.String portName, int baudRate)
      Open a new connection with the specified port and baudrate
      java.lang.String readLine()
      Read the input buffet until a next line character

      Send the string to the serial port

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Communication

        public Communication()
        Initialize an instance of Communication class without open the communication with the device

      • Communication

        public Communication(java.lang.String portName,
                     int baudRate)
        Initialize an instance of Communication class, opening the communication using the specified port and baudrate
        Parameters:
        portName - Name of the serial port to open a communication
        baudRate - Data rate in bits per second. Use one of these values: 300, 600, 1200, 2400, 4800, 9600, 14400, 19200, 28800, 38400, 57600, or 115200

    • Method Detail

      • getPortNames

        public java.lang.String[] getPortNames()
        List all active serial ports names
        Returns:
        An array with the names of all active serial ports

      • openPort

        public boolean openPort(java.lang.String portName,
                        int baudRate)
        Open a new connection with the specified port and baudrate
        Parameters:
        portName - Name of the serial port to open a communication
        baudRate - Data rate in bits per second. Use one of these values: 300, 600, 1200, 2400, 4800, 9600, 14400, 19200, 28800, 38400, 57600, or 115200
        Returns:
        Return true if the port is opened sucessfully

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String data)
        Send the string to the serial port
        Parameters:
        data - String data to send

      • readLine

        public java.lang.String readLine()
        Read the input buffet until a next line character
        Returns:
        A string without the next line character

      • closePort

        public void closePort()
        Close the serial communication
